title: Mum reports burglar son who poured himself a pint and then pinched charity boxes after seeing him on CCTV - Mirror Online

A brazen thief poured himself a pint at a social club before stealing charity donations, booze and a till - but was caught out when his mum recognised him on CCTV. 
Daniel Whitehead snatched nine charity boxes containing donations for the Butterwick Hospice, Air Ambulance and cancer charities, before stashing them in some nearby woods. 
He poured himself a pint before also stealing a till, booze and cash from behind the bar at Thornaby Sports and Leisure Club, Stockton-on-Tees, causing thousands of pounds worth of damage. 
But the 24-year-old was arrested after being identified on CCTV which was circulated on social media and seen by his disappointed mum, Gazette Live reports. 
Several people from Thornaby contacted the club after recognising Whitehead on the footage- as well as his mum. Daniel Whitehead, 24, from Thornaby who appeared at Teesside Magistrates Court (Photo: Evening Gazette) 
Teeside Magistrates Court heard both Whitehead and his mum offered to pay back the money and six of the charity boxes, estimated to contain around £40 each, were returned. 
Whitehead targeted the club at about 1.40am on Sunday, February 5. Read More 
Rachael Dodsworth, prosecuting, said: “The next day staff noticed the metal bar normally used to secure the fire door was next to the door. There was no sign of forced entry.” 
They viewed CCTV which showed Whitehead in the bar area. 
“He took one bottle of Disaronno, one bottle of apple sours and two bottles of WKD,” said Ms Dodsworth. 
“He is seen helping himself to a drink behind the pumps before removing cash and taking the charity boxes. 
“He takes two trips back and forth to the woods where he hides the charity boxes. 
“Six of these boxes were recovered, three were not.” CCTV footage was shared on Facebook of a thief pouring himself a pint and stealing charity boxes from a social club (Photo: Gazette Live) 
He also took £30 from behind the bar and a till containing about £160. 
After the CCTV footage was circulated on social media, Whitehead's mum contacted the club via its Facebook page. 
“She contacted the witness and at a later stage he spoke to her on the phone,” said Ms Dodsworth. 
“She repeatedly apologised and said her son was a drug user but she hadn’t realised he was in as bad a way as he was.” 
Whitehead also contacted the club and offered to return three of the boxes. 
The court heard the dad-of-one, who is a qualified rigger but is currently unemployed, had been drinking whisky and taking cocaine that day. 
Craig Bartram, defending, said Whitehead “has no intention of re-using” cocaine following the burglary. Thief poured himself a pint and then stole charity collection boxes (Photo: Google Maps) 
“He is extremely remorseful, this has been a massive wake-up call,” he said. 
“No money was returned but attempts were made to contact the owner to do so.” 
Whitehead, of Thornaby, pleaded guilty to burglary. 
The court heard he had previous convictions for possession of heroin and cannabis, criminal damage as well as using violence to secure entry to premises. 
He received a 12-week prison sentence suspended for 12 months, a 12-month community order with 20 rehabilitation activity days and 60 hours of unpaid work. 
He was also ordered to pay £735 compensation, court costs of £85 and a charge of £155. Read More 'Spiderman' thief who stole £100million paintings with 'immense' climbing skills jailed for 8 years 
At the time, the director of the club, Peter Scott, said thousands of pounds worth of damage was caused in the burglary. 
“The little so and so took the bottom part of the till which had the float in,” he said. 
“He ripped it out of the wall so all the cables have been damaged.” 
In regards the charity boxes, he said: “We have lots of them for various charities - the Butterwick, the Air Ambulance and cancer charities - I’d guess there was about £30 to £40 in each one.” Like us on Facebook
